actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.Con.Res. 66 (Rep. Rogers):
        A concurrent resolution directing the Secretary of the Senate to make a correction in the enrollment of the bill S. 1071.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S. 1071 (Sen. Cornyn):
        A bill to require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to disinter the remains of Fernando V. Cota from Fort Sam Houston National Cemetery, Texas, and for other purposes.

        -- Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).

        -- Motion by Senator Thune to concur in the House amendment to S. 1071 with an amendment (SA 3961) withdrawn in Senate.

        -- Senate agreed to the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 1071 by Yea-Nay Vote. 77 - 20. Record Vote Number: 648 

 

 S.Amdt. 3961 (Sen. Thune):
        To improve the bill.

        --Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).

        --Proposed amendment SA 3961 withdrawn when motion by Senator Thune to concur in the House amendment to S. 1071 withdrawn in Senate.


 S.Amdt. 3962 (Sen. Thune):
        To improve the bill.

        --Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered).

        --SA 3962 fell when SA 3961 withdrawn.




 S. 2393 (Sen. Moran):
        A bill to authorize a major medical facility project for the Department of Veterans Affairs for fiscal year 2026 in St. Louis, Missouri, and for other purposes.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S. 2503 (Sen. Cruz):
        A bill to require all aircraft to be equipped with Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast In, to improve aviation safety, and for other purposes.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- The committee substitute withdrawn by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 4070 (Sen. Cruz):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 4070 proposed by Senator Cruz.

        --Amendment SA 4070 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 S. 3436 (Sen. Moran):
        A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to require the provision of certain services to veterans in the Freely Associated States, and for other purposes.

        -- Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 492 (Sen. Blackburn):
        A resolution recognizing community care as an essential tool for meeting the health care needs of the veterans of the United States.

        -- Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 566 (Sen. Blumenthal):
        A resolution recognizing that care provided by employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs is essential for meeting the health care needs of veterans of the United States.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
